title: outstanding practice
body: I have been a patient at this practice for over 40 years and have always found everyone I have dealt with unfailingly helpful, kind, caring, prompt in dealing with health problems and getting further help (x-rays, blood tests, scans etc) to process any issues. I cannot praise them enough and have recommended them to others many times over the years and thank them that at 80 I am still going strong.

author: earthje35
title: Virtual visiting has been joyful
body:
My dad is an 86 yr old who requires frequent  Hospital admissions. From the pandemic we have found comfort as a result of virtual visiting provided within CAH.
We have used these visits to not only reassure our father and ourselves, but have found the interaction to be joyful.  By  looking at the garden, seeing his pets, Interacting with his grand children, has all contributed to my father's recovery. 
I also have benefitted personally, as a lupus sufferer, I am shielding as much as humanly possible. Visits to the hospital could result in my own health deteriorating.  So I thank you again as this risk factor has been eliminated, while maintaining the relationship with my father.
We have been so impressed with the service that we purchased  a communal tablet, for my dads unit, in his care home so that other families could chat.
Also a huge thank you for the ease of service, booking is a pleasure. A quality holistic care tool delivered by a warm and understanding team of staff, who genuinely go out of their way to ensure the best quality from the experience.  Truly a real credit to the Trust.
Thank you so much and I hope this service continues in the future.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Absolutely great!
body:
I'm relatively new to the practice but both times  I have been, it's been a very good experience. The doctors have been incredible helpful and lovely to talk to and very reassuring. The front desk staff were very helpful when I was registering and collecting my prescription. 

I would definitely recommend three villages.  I got an appointment very quickly and felt very taken care of.

title: Early intervention
body: I was contacted by a practice nurse to offer me (and my partner) a flu vaccination and was able to book a convenient date over the phone. On the day my partner was still having to isolate for COVID so was unable to attend, but as I didn't and the open-air marquee set-up was safe and quick, I was able to have mine. It was done quickly and painlessly, I had no side-effects other than a slight tender area on the injection site. Thank you for being able to offer a flu jab so early this year.

title: Good
body: Attended The Watford site. the clinic was ok, very clean.  The staff there were very polite and helpful. Would recommend to family if they needed.

title: All round excellent practice
body:
Since joining this practice in 2016 I have had nothing but amazing service here from the reception team, nurses, doctors and all staff and never failed me or my care, general appts, telephone appts, face to face all always been satisfactory !
Also , I have had more diagnosis and referrals for ongoing problems that have been ongoing for years ! Since joining the practice I have actually been getting the right help and treatment for those few issues and at last getting the treatment required, I am always listened to and that means a lot ! So thank you all at Turner Road Surgery present staff and those that have sadly left also!

title: Super nice
body: The clinic was clean, staff were super nice. The appointment ran a little behind but I didn't mind, these things happen.  The doctor did the check up really quickly and explained everything for me.

title: Satisfied patient
body: Very helpful, friendly staff.  Although we had to have a telephone consultation it was followed up with tests.  Test results were quickly related to us.

title: Excellent follow up practices in place
body: The practice has very good follow up practices in place. A reminder text is received prior to appointments which allows you to cancel if required without having to call the surgery. I used this option with the intention of rebooking the next day and calling when phones lines are less busy with patients requiring more urgent attention. I was contacted before I had a chance to ring by a very friendly and efficient receptionist who rebooked my face to face appointment at a time and date convenient to me. I feel this is a very efficient way to perform, it frees phone lines up for patients who need to make contact and should reduce non attenders so having more appointments available. My family have needed the surgery several times during the pandemic and have always received the care we needed and in the appropriate format, a combination of face to face and telephone consultations. The whole team are doing a very good job in these difficult times and also providing a full covid vaccination service to the people of the local area. They are a credit to the NHS

title: friendly staff
body: no matter if its day or night staff they're all fantastic,kind and willing to help irrespective of the matter

author: Stef01276
title: Kind and caring staff
body: I was made to feel really at ease by Charlotte and Sarah during my Mirena Coil replacement. Both were lovely and very professional, and made the experience much better than I had been anticipating! Care was taken to talk me through everything so I felt well informed all the way through and I was so grateful that they were both so kind and caring.

author: km94
title: Grateful and confident following attending the clinic
body:
I attended the fracture clinic at Wishaw General Hospital on 12/10 about an ongoing lower limb issue. I was seen by Ms Crighton who was very caring, compassionate and empathetic towards my injury. Throughout the assessment, I felt assured and informed, and also confident in whatever recommendations were given to me about the next steps- both during the appointment (X-rays) and also moving ahead (scope for further scans in the near future).  
Miss Crighton made me feel comfortable throughout and made the whole in-hospital experience pleasant, simple and straight-forward with no dramas or concerns from my perspective.  
I am extremely grateful for this and I am confident that the next steps recommended by her will be the correct ones.

author: RF20
title: Virtual visiting in Craigavon Area Hospital
body:
My brother has been a patient in CAH for about 6 weeks and during almost all of that time the Virtual Visiting was the only way to keep in touch. When you cannot see your family member for yourself, you always worry, how they are, are they getting better or not. 
I just want to say a big thankyou to all the staff who run the service for their help and kindness in doing their jobs. It is a very big help to the family that we can see and speak to the patient. Thankyou all.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Fantastic Practice
body: Cannot praise this surgery enough! I moved over to the practice from another local one about 5 years ago and there is no comparison. ALL staff are helpful and caring. GPs go above and beyond and will not hesitate to investigate any issues further and support you. The Open Access Clinic is amazing. One of the reasons I moved over for the peace of mind of being guaranteed and to speak to a GP on those days. Brilliant idea to meet the needs of its patients.

title: Lack of parking
body: I was with my daughter of 13 months struggled to find parking. Parking needs to be in place. If this can be improved pl

title: Excellent as usual
body: I have been to the surgery a few times recently and the staff are great and really helpful. Many thanks.

title: Not just kid gloves -- kid's needles too
body: For anyone who feels faint at the thought of a blood test, there are two nurses at this surgery who deserve gold medals when it comes to the art (and science) of phlebotomy. If, like me, you're a big baby when it comes to having blood taken, you'll not only be treated with sensitivity and compassion when it comes to that nasty annual "MOT", you'll probably be treated to children's needles too, making the whole experience a lot less traumatic. And if, like mine, your veins tend to disappear at the mere sight of a syringe, don't worry - the nurses here could probably draw blood from a stone. Recommended!

title: Great Nurse
body:
I attended Hazelwood Avenue surgery this week for my routine cervical screening and just wanted to provide some feedback on the nurse I saw.

Cervical screening is never a totally pleasant appointment, but the nurse by far put me at ease and took time to explain and ask relevant questions more than I’ve ever experienced before. She was genuinely interested in talking openly with me and checking my history of any gynae problems. She also took time to talk to me about the importance of regularly checking my breasts which I don’t remember a nurse ever covering with me before. She directed me to relevant resources to help me with this. 

I just thought that at such a busy time for surgery staff this nurse went over and above in my appointment and I felt the need to share my feedback with you and pass on my thanks.

title: Not so great if you have to work for a living
body: Almost impossible to make contact when you have to work for a living!  I am in clinic  from 8-5.30 with a patient facing roll & therefore are unable to take a call back from GP so they can diagnose you over the phone! When you have no idea at all of when they are likely to call. It's called a telephone appt , however you do not get any kind of window to try & work around. Please bring back the option to book an appt. It's difficult enough for me but husband who leaves for work at 6.30 & gets home at 5.30-6 has no chance at all as does'nt have the luxury of sitting behind a desk making/taking calls at his leisure as he could be 60 feet in the air harnessed to a scissor lift holding electrical cables. Roll on when we both retire then hopefully we can sit at home with a cup of Tea awaiting a call back and actually receive some kind of medical assiatance.

title: A wonderful and caring practice
body: Last month I had an acute attack of cholecystitis.  I was seen on the day, face to face with a GP, treated with antibiotics, a blood test arranged for the next day and an ultrasound for the following week. I was called the day after the scan with the result and a referral letter was written.  I could not fault the care I received from all the members of the Whiteacres team that I came into contact with.

title: Great Practice
body: I must say I find all the people very helpful and so friendly, I find the service very good and any questions I have are answered honestly. I trust the staff with their care and honesty.

title: So worth it!
body: I had my cataract operation at Watford in august - I went back at opticians who was extremely pleased with my eye and its recovery! i can finally see television without glasses  - my vision so clear without glasses! with my age I'm so happy with everything and to see clearly after so long.  i was so scared at first but it all worked out in the end.

author: leatherwh58
title: Thank you for your help and care
body: I joined the diabetes prevention team on zoom.At first I was a bit nervous ,but as the weeks passed our tutor Adam made us all feel very much at ease .Got to know the faces week by week and enjoyed everyone of the classes only missed the last one as I had to go for a Corona test thankfully I was negivate.I have learnt alot about how to keep myself from becoming a diabetic.Like watching my  sugar intake by reading all labels in shops to see the sugar content.Keeping an eyes on the fats as well and eating four hourly instead of just eating when hungry.I now know I need more exercise as it is very important too .I feel alot better health wise ,but hope  I will be able to stick to the plan now that the classes are over.Once again I want to thank Adam and his team for all there help and care throughout the course.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great Practice
body: Great practice with lovely staff. We very accommodating and have tried their best! Would be great to start being able to get more face to face appointments though.

title: Super speedy
body: Called in and an appointment was sorted super quick over the phone ,she was able to get antibiotics sent to chemist and started taking hopefully on mend soon , thank you

title: >Excellent Audiology Department
body:
Clinic 10 which is ENT and Audiology has been helping me professionally, and very well as well as when I need the help for many years (more than 10 years). 
I believe that NHS the greatest thing in UK, and Addenbrookes is one of the best hospitals in UK as well as Worldwide.
In all the years I had treatment in Clinic 10 I never had any complain or negative points.
The Clinical and Administration staff are all professional and well trained to do excellent job.
I had treatment in 13 different Hospitals in UK for different health issues, but I always feel in Clinic 10 of Addenbrookes that I am in good hand, and I really feel I am treated and handled by my family.
I wish you all the success for hundreds of years to come.
Finally, I love you all, true love

readBy.name: Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic team - superb treatment and care
body: Just had day surgery for melanoma skin cancer wider excision and lymph node excision and it went superbly. All of the team were attentive, caring and extremely knowledgeable. So helpful the whole procedure was carried out quickly and successfully. Many thanks to the whole team. I am truly grateful

readBy.name: Queen Victoria Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good Doctors
body: When you can actually get to see your doctor it is really great.  I now have a blood test date and need to make an appointment to see a specialist doctor at the surgery.  I don't envy the staff or doctors as the last 2 years must have been hell for them.  Hopefully things will start to settle down, although flu time is coming.  Please get the flu jab asap as this will lessen pressure on the staff.

title: Very efficient
body: Had my flu jab very well managed and organised. Friendly staff and observing Covid distancing, masks etc.

title: Prompt help
body: Thank you so much for advising me to come for a face to face appointment so quickly. I was seen about two and a half hours after making the call. Your prompt attention has probably saved me from needing to go to hospital for a problem that I didn't really realise needed immediate attention. Unfortunately, our government clearly does not appreciate or understand all the hard work you are doing under very difficult circumstances.

title: Great Practice
body:
This is for A&E, Imaging, Blood analysis, Porters & (in particular) Bay A of Acute Medical Unit Emergency Floor.
Unfortunately I returned via A&E again with further cardiac symptoms plus severe vertigo. Remained for 3 days. No praise too high for all the depts involved, who organised & delivered care and diagnostics (blood tests, ECG's, MRI, CT & Ultrasound scans) with remarkable speed and efficiency very impressive for a hospital and staff under severe pressure (it was "full"). Special praise and gratitude reserved for Emergency Floor AMU doctors & all staff and in particular the Bay A Nurses, HCAs, Infection Control and Nutrition personnel all of whom delivered service of a very high standard, in demanding circumstances not infrequently unpleasant. That is their "normal". 
To witness & experience their skills, commitment, patience and unfailing good humour under those challenging conditions is humbling.
I remain symptomatic but reassured that no significant adverse conditions were revealed.
Thank you very much for your skill & care so much appreciated. Please ensure that this message is conveyed to AMU and Bay A in particular.
Thank you.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Really helpful
body: I went to the reception yesterday as I needed an urgent appointment for my son. The lady I spoke to was so helpful and compassionate. She had to speak with the duty dr so I left and went home. She telephoned me a short while after to let me know a dr would call. The dr called late last night and was just as compassionate and helpful. I telephoned today to book Covid boosters for myself, my husband and my son and flu jabs too. The lady was extremely patient and helpful. I really do appreciate your help. I know that the Limes get a lot of negative comments on social media but I always find that if I really need an appointment I get one and appreciate all the hard work you are doing, especially over the last 18 months. Thank you so much.

title: Fabulous service provision
body:
I've been at this surgery for many years. It astounds me how, at a time of such pressure, the surgery is giving some of the best service it ever has. Phone lines are answered in a timely manner, reception staff are consistently excellent at directing me to the appropriate care provider, and the balance of phone and in person care is appropriate to need. Repeat prescriptions are authorised in a timely manner and the team are responsive to out of the ordinary questions or enquiries. 
I hear such sad tales of other local surgeries struggling to even provide a basic service. I find the service here exemplary. Thank you all.

title: Amazing staff and treatment
body: I have just had a 3 day stay in the hospital,  ward B24, after breaking my knee. From start to finish, I've had first class treatment all the way. The staff have been amazing, as they were in the A and E department,  working under such stressful conditions!

title: Positive Experiences
body:
In the wake of much recent criticism of GPs, negative media coverage and planned government intervention I wanted to highlight the positive experience I’ve just had at the Infirmary Drive surgery.

Having had no reason to contact the surgery for the past 17 years, in the last 4 weeks I have had cause to phone five times. On each occasion I was phoned back by a doctor within 30-90 minutes and seen, on 3 occasions that same morning. Additionally I received follow-up calls, including one after admission to hospital, on 3 occasions. At all times the doctors showed empathy and were quick to contact outside specialists for further assistance.

While negative experiences are often highlighted in reviews positive ones are less likely to be, so I wanted to pass on my thanks for how my own personal medical problems (still ongoing) have been handled. At a worrying time it has been much appreciated.

title: Fantastic service
body:
Most news articles would lead you to believe that GP's have been doing very little in the pandemic, this definitely isn't the case with Trevelyan House.
I have been ill a lot in the past 6 months and this surgery has done the most for me. Not only have they been running COVID vaccination clinics, i've been able to get face to face appointments with doctors and when it's been online it's been on time and they haven't made me feel rushed.  
The service is truly exceptional- today I had an appointment, they prescribed me a new drug and the prescription was ready for me to collect from the pharmacy down the road from me within half an hour. 
I feel that I am listened to and am treated with dignity and great care- something that even without the pandemic I have not felt from many of my previous doctors practices.

title: Great service on-line and face to face
body: I rarely contact the doctors. I had a minor issue that I raised on-line and a prescription was sent through to my local chemist. I like the on-line facility as I do not want to have to go to the doctor for minor issues. I had another issue that I had to ring up about. I had a telephone consultation which resulted in me being asked to go. I had a fantastic service by the doctor

title: Exemplary practice
body:
I was a patient at Northenden for 40 years until very recently, when I moved home. This practice has looked after my every need and has given excellent care, professionalism and courtesy. 
I extend my sincere thanks to all doctors, nurses, receptionists, specialist clinics etc. I really did not want to have to leave Northenden, where I had the best support and health care possible from a GP Practice.  I cannot understand the level of criticism levelled at Northenden - it seems to me to be completely unjust and totally unfair. If you need a doctor, you get a doctor - they care and do more than humanly possible to aid and assist patients, especially in these difficult times for the NHS. 
Thank you everyone at Northenden Health Centre for looking after me in such as exemplary manner for so many years. I applaud you all.

title: Pleased with the practice
body: There has been a lot of talk about doctors not seeing patients face to face. My husband and I have needed to see a GP on several occasions since the Covid pandemic began. If necessary we have been able to come to the surgery on the same day which we really appreciate. Thank you. We have also been contacted by an phone which was appropriate and easier than coming to the surgery.

title: An Outstanding Practice
body:
The several questions I had were answered clearly and I felt listened to and reassured. I understood clearly what further appointments were needed. As always, I was left feeling informed and very confident in my treatment. 
I have been with the practice for many years and am immensely grateful for the excellent care I have received. 
The way in which the practice has continued to care for its 
patients in the recent difficult times has,  in my own case, been exemplary.

title: Wonderfully Caring Doctors and very helpful Staff
body:
I have been looked after by Abridge Surgery for many years now.
I have always been treated with wonderful kindness. Doctor has always been very patient with me and helpful.
I am deeply grateful to everyone at The Abridge Surgery.
I feel very fortunate  to be a patient at such
 a well run and thoughtful practice.
Thank you very much.

title: Elmstead day centre - Excellent!
body: The staff here are excellent , friendly, helpful, informal and efficient . My procedure was carried within the target time and the service brilliant. Thank you!

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful practice
body: All of our conversations with the reception team, dispensers, nurses and consulting with the doctor, have always had the most professional, friendly and timely care. As a family we are immensely grateful for everything you have done for us and our neighbours throughout the pandemic and beyond. We are astonished at the GP negativity and wanted to extend our heartfelt thanks and appreciation for being there for us. We have huge admiration for you all and the current government comments and press cover does not represent us, or anyone we know. Thank you 🌈

title: Simply amazing
body: I have seen lots of negative feedback about GPs recently but have to say this surgery has been simply fantastic. They never fail to answer the phone, always see you if necessary but similarly provide great advice over the phone. The reception staff are so friendly and helpful and the doctors are doing a smashing job. Thank you so much!

title: Amazing care
body: My father was recently seen in your TIA clinic, he had an appointment within 24 hrs of referral, on the day he had all the tests and investigations required but not only all done in one day was then seen by the consultant with all the results and given treatment to hopefully prevent further incident. This is a remarkable service and one the rest of the nhs could learn so much from. It’s preventative medicine which must cost a lot but if prevents further need for care will pay for itself. This service needs to be shouted about and widely acknowledged! I hope it saves many lives!

title: Efficient flu clinic
body: I went to the outdoor flu jab clinic and was very impressed with the speed of service and efficiency of this appointment!

title: Excellent service
body: Following a telephone call with a GP I was sent for tests and I was seen for a face to face appointment within two weeks and I was extremely impressed with the service at this GP practice.

title: Excellent, fast service
body: My child had a problem that warranted a face to face appointment, and was given one very quickly, problem quickly diagnosed and appropriate medicine prescribed - could not fault the excellent care despite all the negative press at the moment, thank you for all your work

title: Superb
body: Excellent care received following brain operation. Kind, attentive, genuinely friendly and caring nursing. Never problems getting information or feedback to family.

title: Heartbreak
body:
My father in law was in ward B6 from Sept 16th to Oct 5th this year with cancer. He wasn’t allowed any visits from family in spite of numerous pleas, as staff said he wasn’t ill enough. He also broke his phone in the ward and staff restricted the number of calls that could be made on the ward phone. 
Sadly two days after he came home he passed away. The family are devastated at losing a chance to see him in the last three weeks of his life.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Reception Staff Totally Unresponsive!
body:
Today was one of many times where the biggest issue with this local GP service is the reception.
Today I was first in the queue for 43 mins.  Last week my husband called, was on the line for 40 mins then the called dropped as it was lunchtime. Unfortunately not the first time this has happened.
The doctors are really great though and have over the years been very helpful - it is a shame this part of the clinic really next the process down.
I read on some of the other reviews they were looking for a new phone system in 2020 - what happened to that?

title: Exemplary Practice
body:
A few months ago, after moving house, I very reluctantly, moved to Heald Green Health Centre 1 (with little knowledge of them).
To say that I am delighted with the service I am receiving would be an understatement.
I have been made to feel welcome, and secure in the knowledge that this Practice will care for my medical needs to the best of their ability.  
I wish to express my sincere thanks to the doctors, nurses, receptionists and other professionals within this practice. Over recent months I have needed their expertise many times and all have impressed me hugely.
Everyone is friendly, courteous, extremely professional in manner and happy to be of help.  The on-line service for prescriptions etc. is excellent and works very well for me.  
Considering we are living through such difficult times and given the pressure upon GP practices, Heald Green No. 1 have been fantastic.
I applaud you all.  Thank you.

title: Kindness and empathy in the emergency department
body:
I had to attend Lewisham A and E this week having never been to hospital before in my life. For various reasons I was very scared of spending extended time in the A and E waiting room. When I explained this to the triage nurse she immediately said I was welcome to wait just outside the triage room rather than in A and E proper and she would simply call me from there when ready. I am sure it only felt like a minor  thing to her (or anyone reading this!) but that small act of understanding and kindness made such a difference to my experience. I hope I am lucky enough not to need to return any time soon but if I do, it will be with considerably less fear and anxiety. I should also say I was treated with empathy and respect by all the staff I saw, clinical or otherwise, and felt listened to and like my issue was taken seriously. 

Thank you.

title: Couldn't have been faster
body: My child came home from school with a nasty looking infected cut on his hand. Slightly fearing the worst due to the media coverage of waiting times we called reception to ask what to do. Within 10 minutes we'd received a GP callback and sent over a photo.  Within 45 mins we had a collected a prescription from the pharmacy and started a course of antibiotics. Pretty impressive and much appreciated! Thank you.

title: Bingham should administer the Coronavirus…
body: I wasn’t sure how to lodge a complaint, but I wanted you to at least read this. I realize the NHS has a lot on its plate at the moment and I don’t have a particular problem with Bingham Medical Centre.  I have only lived in Bingham for just over a year, I look after my mother who has dementia.  I think it’s a mistake for Bingham not to be involved in the vaccine program, particularly now for the booster jabs. Not everyone has a car to get to the various vaccine centres. Personally, I don’t mind taking my chances on the public transport, I can go to Boots the chemist’s at the Victoria Centre etc., but it’s more tricky for my mother.  We have friends with cars, of course, but realistically a £40 taxi journey is needed.  And I just don’t get it?  Surely, if Bingham Medical Centre took part in the vaccine rollout, everyone’s a winner: more people vaccinated more cheaply, and great publicity for the practice. I think for these reasons and others, the centre has made a massive error. Even if the vaccine was administered by Bingham pharmacy, that would be something. At this stage, it can’t be that difficult to organize.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: The best practise
body: As always, Stillington Surgery stands out as the best surgery in the UK by a country mile. The staff are courteous, helpful and attend to detail looking after their patients. Just a wonderful bunch. Well done all.

title: Mixed comments - Good and Bad
body: Its almost impossible to get hold of the practice via telephone. I'm always waiting for someone to pick up for a minimum of 30 minutes. Ive gone from no3 to no1 on hold in 1hr 10 mins at 5pm. A joke. When I can speak to a receptionist or dr I am dealt with efficiently and quickly and usually get what I need but its the waiting times on the phone that put me off. I suffer mental health and sometimes need to speak to someone assertiviely and quickly but the receptionists seem incapable to answer the telephones quick enough. Drs and nurses are lovely, empathetic and work very well.

title: Receptionist
body:
Non inclusive practice for patients who are unable to ring in the morning. Explained this to rude receptionist who accused me of arguing with her when I explained this. 
The hours to make an appointment at this surgery are not inclusive to patients who cannot call and wait on the phone for an hour.

title: Very happy with telephone consultations
body: I have really appreciated having the telephone consultation option with Cuckoo Lane during the pandemic and I have been very satisfied with the advice given and the follow up of prescriptions or tests. I think the call back system, where I know I can speak to a medical person on the same day, is preferable to trying to get a face to face appointment at short notice, which can be very difficult and stressful. I would like the telephone appointment system to become a regular part of the service as in my opinion it works well for many medical problems and is a good use of primary care resources.

title: Shocking and unexceptable
body: Phoned a few weeks back tonask why my son who is extremely vunrable hadn't been invited for the covid jab..the receptionist said someone would call me back, they never did, another 4 weeks later and only just got him booked in for mid November...I also ask for a call back from the gp today I got told I was put on the list and absolutely no call back, this surgery gets worse

title: Poor practice
body: Attended for an abdominal scan after being referred by a GP. Difficult to describe the experience but I felt really uncomfortable throughout the appointment. Sonographer was unresponsive and made no attempt to offer any reassurance. Scan was completed in a robotic fashion and I was offered no warning about potential for some pain and discomfort during the examination. Over two months later and the GP has still not received the report. I really don't want to have to be put through that again.

title: Dentaline Medway - Rude Customer advisor
body:
After calling 111 they referred me to contact Dentaline as recommend for me to be seen.
Called at 6pm and was put on hold for 40 minutes for a very rude lady who was unhelpful, rushed me through the questions to be told, Nope! I don’t qualify to be seen.
Bad attitude and rude manner! Wouldn’t let you speak rather than rudely interrupt. Advised that I would be putting a complaint about her rudeness for her to then accusing me of being rude.
“Computer says No” attitude and not the sort of uncaring person you want working for our NHS!

title: Absolutely dire
body: This is now my second review of this surgery and it’s appalling reception staff. I phoned this morning to make an appointment as I have ran out of antidepressants and have been told I need a mental health review. It took me 2.5 hours to actually get through by which time obviously all the ‘appointments’ (telephone consultations) were filled. The receptionist showed no understanding of the fact the surgery has a duty of care to ensure patients have medication and expected me to wait two days to get my prescription filled. After repeatedly informing her that there is a duty of care, she finally agreed she would ‘see’ if the doctor could do it today. Unsurprisingly, an hour later the prescription had been signed off by the person with an actual medical degree who understands that you cannot leave a vulnerable patient without their medication. The reception staff need to understand that life is complicated and there are many reasons why someone who suffers anxiety and depression, works a 72 hour week, cares for 2 small children and is still suffering post Covid fatigue, failed to sort the prescription. Have some empathy for goodness sake!

title: Absolutely fabulous
body: As the rules state I can’t give the names of the gp and nurse who helped me I won’t in this review but I’m happy to provide them. Everyone I spoke to this week has been absolutely amazing. The gp was wonderful, got back to me very quickly via the online form and then asked me to come in to further deal with my issue. They couldn’t have been more understanding or set me at ease any more. I was told to book blood tests in at reception, and when I did the nurse said I can get you done now if I have time (if that’s not efficient I don’t know what is!) I then got my blood results and a call from the gp the very next day. All of the staff were incredibly polite and well organised, I’m really glad that city health is my gp practise, I feel I couldn’t be in better hands. Given the pressure the nhs is under at the moment at city health they are doing a fabulous job!

author: Dragonflyz24
title: Fractured Wrist
body:
I fell and fractured my wrist on Sun. My experience across the various services I had contact with in the NHS in the last 3 days was magnificent. I was taken by ambulance to Hairmyres Minor Injuries and the paramedics were great. Really reassuring and efficient.  
The staff in Minor Injuries dealt with me promptly and efficiently and with care. Thank you to the nurses, practitioners, radiographers and porters. I had surgery at the day surgery unit at Wishaw University Hospital. My short stay was very comfortable and I felt very well attended and informed. I was impressed by the level of cleanliness. Thanks to all the doctors and consultants that attended me, and to the nurses and assistants pre and post op.  
I'd particularly like to thank Vikki, who took care of me on arrival in Day Surgery, Eugene and Nora who kept me calm in pre-op and Tracy who attended to me pre discharge. Having never previously been in hospital I was a bit apprehensive about having surgery but everyone was very reassuring and kept me well informed of what was happening. Our NHS and the people who work in it are something to be cherished. My heartfelt thanks go to all who were involved in my care over the last 3 days.

readBy.name: Imperial College London, Faculty of Medicine

title: Exceptional
body: From the first time I visited this practice I have been amazed by the care and compassion myself and my family have been shown. Nothing is too much trouble from the lady’s who answer the phone, the pharmacy staff and the doctors and nurses. There has been some negative things said about Frampton surgery recently but I cannot fault them in normal times and in a pandemic.

title: care and comfort from Distrist nurse during those final days
body:
Care and comfort from District nurse during the final days of my family members life  
[Very happy with 'Keeping in touch']  
I would just like to say thank you to Lurgan District Nursing team, especially Margarete , Derbhla,Carloyn and Martina for the care and compassion they showed to us as a family. They went over and beyond each and every day. W  
[Very happy with 'Staff attitude']  
  
[Very happy with 'Staff skills']  
  
[Very happy with 'Team work']  
  
[Very happy with 'Daily living support']

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: unusable
body: almost impossible to get even a telephone appointment. its doc iq system is unusable. they have canceled all my medications without reason and i cannot get a review. they only allow calls at 8 to 9 am and by the time the que is finished it is all run out or just cuts out. i have waited on phone several times over 45 mins or an hour. in the years here i never get to see a doctor or speak to the same one twice. at 8.20 i have been no. 8 for 20 mins. dreadful. how much do they get paid for this ?

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Discharge Distress
title: The discharge process at QA Hospital Portsmouth
body:
In September 2021 I was asked if I would go to a newly established Discharge Lounge at Portsmouth QA hospital to free up my bed after having had emergency surgery for appendicitis and peritonitis a few days before, against the best judgement of the ward sister. She felt under pressure to provide beds, and I fully understood the need to free up A&E beds, having spent 8 hours there myself on 9 September.  
I agreed after being told that she understood that the Discharge Lounge was staffed by nurses, and set up with the necessary facilities to care for my needs.  
I was told there may be a delay in providing my drugs for discharge. I was taken down in a wheelchair from the comfort of a bed on a ward to a large room set out with upright chairs, which were very uncomfortable given my wounds. After half an hour I was in such discomfort that I had to walk around for half an hour, by which time I was exhausted. I asked for a pillow so that I could have a degree of comfort. None were available and a member of staff had to go to a ward to obtain a pillow. Eventually I was offered a chair with foot support, the only one in the room.  
I eventually spent 3 hours waiting for my drugs, with no pain relief. By the time my drugs were delivered I was exhausted and in pain.  
The chief nursing officer and chief executive visited the lounge whilst I was there and I recounted my experience to them. I write this in the hope that my comments were taken on board and that facilities have been improved and delays reduced.  
It was known the previous day that I was due to be discharged and if my prescriptions has been filled in advance the process would have been much shorter.  
It is unacceptable to have only one chair with foot support available when people are going home with surgical wounds and in severe discomfort.  
My life was saved, for which I thank the medical and nursing staff profusely, however the discharge process caused unnecessary pain and suffering and I hope that the process has been improved since my experience.

title: covid boster
body: went for my booster jab this morning. arrived a few mins early as is my custom only to be told they were running approx 20 mins late and go away and come back later did as told only to be told on my return to go away again . when i at last got in it was a shambles 30 to 40 people al crowded together waiting jabs no distancing rules ques of people standing together. obviously booked appointments to close together.

author: TPPcglbrum
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I now have a better understanding of my addiction
body:
It was from the age of 14 when I first started to drink, I was allowed to at family events as alcohol was heavily ingrained into the culture of my family’s celebrations. I didn’t notice that I had a problem with alcohol as I associated my drinking with happy times and people enjoying themselves. Over time my family would comment on how much I was drinking and express their concern for me. However I wasn’t prepared to address my issues regarding alcohol, therefore my problems continued.  
I would often leave myself with no money for the rest of the week because I had spent it all on alcohol. I found myself becoming aggressive and staring fights unnecessarily, I had even been so drunk that I’d wander home alone putting myself into vulnerable situations. Due to my actions I have lost many relationships, with friends and family, as they no longer trust me, I’ve missed countless Sundays with my children because I was hungover. To top it all off I have given myself liver problems as a result to my years of binge drinking.  
I tried to take control of my problems many times, I avoided friends who would invite me out and I even went as far as giving away my bank card so I could withdraw money, unfortunately I realised these options weren’t realistic and didn’t work. Eventually I reached out to my GP who referred me to CGL. From sitting their course my CGL keyworker informed me about Intuitive Thinking Skills, this sounded like the solution I was looking for and I asked to be referred so I could have a better understanding of my addiction. I then sat their Intuitive Recovery, Skills Tu Life and Enoughs Enough courses. My experience there was very positive, I was able to further my understanding about addiction and how my brain was working. The tutors I sat these course with were friendly and extremely helpful. I even found a new job more suitable than my previous one with their help.  
The Intuitive Recovery course teaches many different tools and skills to use in day to day life but the one that with me the most was transposing, separating whether I want something or if IT wants something. I often use this for decision making in all aspects of life. I noticed I needed to use my ADR (Addictive Desire Recognition) a lot, however my brain has now made new associations and I find that my AD (Addictive Desire) doesn’t kick in half as much.  
Since completing the courses I have rebuilt relationships with my friends and family, I am now sober and able to spend more time with my children which has meant a much better relationship between us, I have a new job with more money to spend, and finally I am happier, healthier and my mental state is much more stable. I am now planning to continue building these relationships, progress with my career and set a good example for my children.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Quite lovely
body: During these tricky times I think it’s appropriate to thank all the staff for the work they’re doing. I saw the GP and before id left the premises a connection had been sent to my phone to help with advice on my condition. The reception staff tried to book me for physio but there’s huge demand so I’m hoping I can get it sometime in the future. A fast friendly and supportive and informative experience. I’m always fast to moan so today I needed to say something complimentary and give thanks to the hard working nhs and the staff who do an amazing job. Thank you all.

title: excellent service
body: Telephone conversation. Thorough, good listener, advice given with detailed description of my problem.

author: Vancouver Man
title: Exemplary customer care, empathy and professionalism
body:
Attended Forth Valley Hospital for surgery. The three staff, David, Aileen and Nicole, showed exemplary customer care, empathy and professionalism in attended to my needs.  
Communication regarding what was going to happen was excellent as was the blether we had to keep my mind off what was actually going on.  
Despite what is happening across the NHS it is reassuring that life goes on and that we can rely on these professionals when we need them.

title: Poor practice
body: To long waiting on the phone very abrupt staff told to ring before 8am never get though most of the time trying to get a face to face appointment poor practice 1 star out of 5 could down a lot better

title: Left hand don’t know what right hand is doing
body: Instead of getting certain medication prescriptions from Doctors surgery, it was decided that the Hospital should take responsibility of the prescriptions. Complete shambles. A private healthcare provider is involved. You cannot contact anyone as no one knows. Was on phone from 9:00am till 5 pm in the end was told to phone 111. They could not prescribe tablets. So now have run out of medication.

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: Awful
body: Need immediate treatment. Can't speak to a GP. Told I'd get a call in a week. Stay well away. I'll use 111 instead from now on and sign up with a different surgery.

author: nitrategg46
title: Care given for drain
body:
Very happy with the care given  
Would have appreciated an earlier warning of visit

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Terrible attitude to patients in clear and…
body:
I called to make an appointment to SEE a doctor, after being advised to do by a TalkWorks therapist to talk about medication. Phones cause me great anxiety which I explained when I made a huge effort to phone for an appointment. I was told 'If you mental health is that bad, you have to go to A&E'!

Totally unhelpful and uncaring attitude shown by this surgery. It was my first interaction having moved from another surgery who were not delivering, and it will most likely be my last.

title: Excellent practice
body:
second comment as first not showing 
Given the bad press GPS are getting at the moment I would like to go on record and state that Oak Vale Medical Practice is incredible.
All the staff from receptionist to Doctors are very  friendly helpful and give the highest standard of care
There are a lot of comments in the media about the lack of face to face examination .Well they do not apply to this practice .
I have had two f2f  in the past month 
They operate a triage system that works very well. If the doctor can’t resolve the issue by phone then you are given a appointment, usually that day
An excellent caring practice 
Thanks to all concerned.

author: Starsky
title: My Daddy who is recovering from COVID
body: My 81 year old Daddy started to deteriorate from day 10-12 of a positive COVID diagnosis.  We contacted his local GP who referred him immediately to the Southern Trust Acute Care at Home team.  Within 1 hour we had 2 nurses and a registrar assessing my Daddy at home.  Over the next 3 days my Dad had seen Nurses, a Registrar and a Consultant and had a chest X-ray.  I cannot fault this service or praise the team enough.  Myself and my brothers where extremely worried and thought for sure Dad would have to be admitted to hospital.  As a very active and independent man I don't think he would have coped very well in hospital.   The fact that he had 1st rate medical care within his own home, I believe, contributed to how quickly he started to recover.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent all the way
body: From the moment I entered the hospital until the time I left I received 1st class treatment and was made to feel I was the most important person there..I was even given a drink and a sandwich..Although I was there for several hours I wasn't kept waiting and went from one procedure to another seamlessly.  Thank you so much to all the staff who made my visit so stress free..Brilliant..

title: Well organised practice.
body: They have put thought into what the patients need and seem to organise things properly. The centre is well spaced out and feels safe in terms of covid prevention.

author: JK Daughter
title: Patient centred care
body:
My mum required to be seen by GP out of hours for assessment. We attended the Queen Margaret Hospital as requested. My mum was anxious and was wanting me to come with her when she was called through. When she was called I was told I had to wait in the waiting area, on stating that she wanted me with her I was told I was not aloud and the Dr left without finding out the reasons why.  
I understand the pressures of covid and risk assessing however as a healthcare worker I was under the impression that patients came first and in certain circumstances we should aim to be supportive where necessary. My mum is a pensioner with medical conditions which make her susceptible to serious infections and hospitalisations, she is extremely anxious when having to come into hospital for any reason.  
This is not the first time I have had issues in Queen Margaret Hospital, although I did not highlight this issue at the time. Again whilst with my mum attending minor injuries, reception staff were very abrupt when I said she needed me with her, I was rudely told well you probably wont get in the room with the nurse as it is a small room! Then the staff member stormed off.  
Working in an environment myself seeing patients on a daily basis, we should be seen to be courteous, helpful and supportive of the patients requiring our services.

author: arieswx37
title: Flu Jab
body: I felt that the customer service was amazing. EXCELLENT

author: Frances7
title: My eyelid surgery in Queen Margaret Hospital, Dunfermline
body:
My vision had gradually deteriorated - not because of my eyes, but because loose skin above them was obscuring my upper vision. Everything I looked at had a dark shadow above it. I could not see the upper flashes in a peripheral eye test.  
On Monday I had an operation to remove the excess skin. Dr Saxby was so kind and reassuring, as were all the nurses and other carers. I felt I was in very good hands. The scars should be invisible, as they are in the crease of the eyelid.

author: Tayman118
title: Professional touch
body:
Hi  
Attended Forth Valley Royal Hospital in Larbert as an outpatient on 7th October 2021.  
The clinic I attended was the BAU Contingency Surgical Skin Team and in attendance were two expert practitioners David and Aileen.  
I was welcomed by both and an explanation of the procedure was given. David took the lead and carried out the operation while Aileen supported him the whole time. Both chatted to me throughout the thirty or so minutes, which helped me to relax until the operation was completed.  
Once dressed David advised me to have a relaxing evening at home and if I had any problems or concerns to contact either the hospital or my GP.  
While Aileen was escorting me to the exit of the ward she was asking me if I felt alright, which I thought was a very professional touch.  
I could not have asked for a better team to attend to me, as both David and Aileen were excellent in every way.  
Kind regards

author: sherwoodranger
title: Very professional North district nursing visits
body:
I returned home after a short stay in hospital with a back and bladder problem, I was fitted with a catheter, the district nursing service contacted me and arranged to visit and make sure I understood how everything was working and how to change the catheter bags. they also arranged with my GP regarding a trial without the catheter.  
the service rang several times to make sure everything was ok. the district nurse visited yesterday morning to remove the catheter then rang through out the day to check i was ok then visited in the afternoon to perform an ultra sound. with everything being clear she arranged to speak with me this morning to check again if I was ok, she is now going to pass all of the results on to my GP. she left me with phone numbers to ring if I had any problems day or night, which was very reassuring. the whole service was very professional

title: Great experience
body: I visited The Railings this am for my booster Covid vaccine. So easy to park, I was welcomed by a Lady & Gentleman who took my details & directed me to another pleasant Gent who took further details, I was called in straight away, the vaccine was given me by a lovely lady. I then sat for 15mins before going to my car. Fantastic service, Thank you to all the Volunteers, you do an amazing job. 👏👏👏

readBy.name: Coventry and Warwickshire Partnership NHS Trust

title: minor injury unit  Kingsbridge Hospital
body: Courteous, friendly,& efficient staff treated a venomous shark wound this afternoon with minimum fuss & discomfort.

title: Disgusting “service”
body:
I called for an emergency appointment and waited 5 hours for a call back. When I gave in and called again to chase as I was in agony and needed help, the doctor called and I missed it. I asked the receptionist to ask them to call me back ASAP. She told me I’d been taken off the call list. At this point I started to cry and asked her to please get someone to call me. I have been waiting an hour and will have to call an ambulance as my eyes are swollen half shut and I have a 2 year old at home so I can’t drive. 
Doctors aren’t even seeing patients face to face despite every other industry being back open so I don’t know why they don’t have the time to give someone clearly in distress and agony a 2 minute call. 
An ambulance which could be used to save someone’s life now used to collect someone who just needed some antibiotics. Absolutely disgusting.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: GREAT PRACTICE
body: Mount Medical Practice is an excellent GP surgery. All the doctors are very friendly and provide time to talk to you. The receptionists are also very helpful. Thank you very much.

author: Linsmoo
title: Poor care Ninewells A&E
body:
I attended A&E Ninewells with an ankle injury.  
Eventually seen by a member of staff who was reluctant to x-ray, however there was a red flag of pain at lateral malleolus. X-ray confirmed avulsion fracture. The member of staff was very dismissive of the injury: no exercises given, no longer tubigrip and no moonboot. I was told the virtual fracture clinic would follow me up, but they have failed to refer me. MIU at St Andrews gave me the missing care (exercises, moonboot, advice and tubigrip). They called me today after I self referred myself yesterday. Thankfully I have done all I needed to and I feel it helps that I am a nurse. The staff member at Ninewells wrote very scant notes and said my trainers, limp and short tubigrip were suffice. The moonboot subsequently given was much safer (ankle support) and more comfortable to wear.  
This time, I cannot say good care was given.

readBy.name: Office of Murdo Fraser, MSP for Mid Scotland & Fife
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Shocking! Find somewhere else!
body: I tried all day to get through to them with fail! Eventually after 111 said I needed to see them and still couldn’t get through I went to my pharmacist who gave me the same advise. I walked in there with a sample stating what 111 had said and the pharmacist, they took it and told me to call back after 6. At this point they were closed and the out of hours number given on there line at 6:30 stated rudely it wasn’t.

title: Thank-you all for showing how it should be done!
body: The press coverage of GP services does not apply to this practice. I have experience of a previous really dreadful service in Bournemouth and my faith in the NHS has been restored since registering at Highcliffe. The whole service is very well run, telephones answered promptly, really friendly receptionists and good use of volunteers. Telephone appointments are useful as appropriate and when it is necessary face to face appointments are provided as a follow up, no pleading required! In both my own and my husbands case we were seem the same day. If this surgery can do it then so can all others.. it should be held up as an example of efficiency, empathy and professionalism. Thank-you it is much appreciated.

author: millimeterzf86
title: They looked after me exceptionally
body: I was treated very well on Forrester Hill ward 101. I was in for 2 days, the doctors, nurses and everybody were all very very good, the food was good, I've no complaints. They looked after me exceptionally.

title: Great service every time I’ve needed them
body: Each time I have needed any medical care for myself or my children the practice have been fantastic. The reception staff are super helpful and always return calls when needed. The GPs are friendly, approachable and communicate very well especially with my children. I’ve always had the opportunity to see a GP face to face when required but I’m also very happy with the options for online advice where appropriate. Throughout the pandemic I didn’t miss a cervical screening or a general health check that was scheduled for my age. I just wanted to say I’d highly recommend this practice and I hope other people recognise what a great job our primary care doctors and teams are doing in very difficult circumstances.

title: UMAC absolutely fantastic service
body: From beginning to end the service I received from UMAC was second to none. All staff were polite, professional and patient. Keep up the good work.

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Flu vaccination initiative
body:
Earlier this month I attended a Saturday morning flu vaccination clinic. The whole thing was really well organised, from the volunteers outside to the doctor giving me the flu jab.
Great idea to do it like that and big thanks to all involved.
More generally, my experience at this surgery over the past few years has been very good.

title: One of the Best Hospitals Around
body: I stayed here for just under a week following my spinal surgery. The care from all of the staff involved was exemplary. My recovery wasn’t straight forward whilst I was here due to my medication; however, the staff kept me as comfortable as possible. The cleaning staff were very thorough and came into my room multiple times per day with mops, cloths and disinfectant. This is a brilliant hospital and even the food was satisfactory.
